pros: A charity organisation with a difference

there is a lot going on and there are many chances to do something new or different than what your role is. this is really useful to volunteers/interns who want to gain some good skills before moving on.
cons: it can be really chaotic and things dont always get done efficiently in the office. it would be really useful to really focus on stream lining tasks and activities so no one is confused. it took more than a month to understand what my role was.

pros:
Rewarding work with real impact in people's lives 
Got to work on many projects and gain a lot of experience
cons:
Unpaid internship 
Didn't feel like I had much guidance 
Forced to wear a ton of hats due to low staff

pros: Nice location, relaxed dress code and nothing else.
cons: Outdated or broken equipment and ideas, not to the industry standards and ridiculously large workload
